conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team. I’m Student_E and I’m very interested in joining School_A this year. I believe I would be a strong, committed member of your community and I’m ready to accept an offer if extended. Thank you for considering my application.

I am 1st in School_A's priority and 1st in School_B's priority, making acceptance very likely there. Since School_A is my 3rd true choice (better than School_B, which is last), I should secure School_A now with an [APPLY] to guarantee a strong outcome rather than risk losing all seats while chasing School_C.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

We look forward to welcoming you this year.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and currently no matches. Although Student_B also applied and ranks School_A first, Student_B is only #4 on our priority list. Accepting Student_E now secures our top-choice match and removes risk of losing them to other schools (Student_E ranks School_A 3rd and could be accepted by higher-ranked options). Therefore, accept Student_E.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying. School_A is my first-choice school because I’m looking for a rigorous environment and I’m ready to fully commit to your program if admitted. If offered a seat, I will accept and enroll.

We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the remainder of the placement process.

Sincerely,

Maintain professionalism and, if possible, encourage Student_B to pursue other options in the market.
